review: It has been forever and one day since I have stepped foot in a Red Robin, but my partner has been incessantly asking me to go there, as he has never been there. I tried to tell him he wasn't missing much, but sometimes you have to figure it out for yourself.  We were greeted promptly and had a wonderful waitress. It was one aspect of the food that I have a bone to pick with ("surprise, surprise ... it's a chain restaurant," you must be saying). I ordered the bacon burger. Since this is a "gourmet burger" place and it stated "applewood smoked bacon," I expected awesomeness. When it came out, I bit into it and was a bit shocked. Instead of having regular slices of bacon, they used the pre-cooked, microwaveable bacon that was soggy. I was disappointed. If other restaurants can use real bacon, why can't they? Also, what's up with the TVs? I guess they were going for a nostalgic vibe, as I have not seen tube televisions in restaurants in years. Even their bar area had them ... So I guess this isn't the place to hang out and watch a game? All-in-all, an ok experience. They get a thumbs up for their drinks and service.
A nice place to eat, good food ( burgers are killer ) I recommend
Gluten free buns for burgers and gluten free fries, my son is happy :)

Was excited to try here since we don't have one in Hawaii. Nothing really to write home about...  being Asian, they sat us by the kitchen, and the food was okay.  All you can eat steak fries, but I never got more since I was going wine tasting and didn't want to get too full.  Overall, an okay place to eat, although there are better places to eat than here.

Not bad for a chain burger joint.  Have ate at this one several times and the latest time was today and everything was spot on.  Place was clean, service was quick and both orders placed were good.  I had the AvoCobb Salad with grilled chicken breast and I would order it again.  They don't use the cheap "Squeeze-tube-type" Ranch dressing which is a big plus.  While waiting for our order, the waitress brought out some of those tasty Red Robin fries at no charge and "Just because".  You gotta love this place!
Red Robin is just OK in my book.  Service has gone downhill over past couple of years while price has gone up.  Also, VERY loud.  Went here because there aren't that many options in Sherwood.

Went here Tues night with friends. I'm not a big Red Robin fan for sure. I don't really like it here but since my friend picked this place out, I figured I had better oblige.  There were 8 of us. 5 adults and 3 kids. I ordered what I thought looked the best and was the healthiest choice, with me trying to eat healthier. I ordered some of that new roasted vegetable soup which looked so good on the flyer thing on the table, I was so soo sold, but when it came.. super disappointment. It looked nothing like that. I guess I should have expected that. I didn't eat anything else. I had a couple of cocktails after that and that was it. I wouldn't go back here to this one or any other Red Robin. Just not my thing..

I am a burger snob and I won't usually order a hamburger unless I know it's going to be amazing. For the most part, this Red Robin keeps up with the usual Red Robin standard. But the service can be a bit off, either you don't get seated in a reasonable time or you get seated and the servers don't get to the table in a reasonable amount of time. The thing that keeps me coming back is the burgers.  The kids menu is great and the servers don't cringe if your kid smudges ketchup all over the table. It's not a bad place for a kid's birthday dinner.  If you're over twenty-one and want to kill time before going to the movies, visit the bar. You can still enjoy the full menu or the special happy hour menu.

My family and I plus my best friend who was in town for a visit decided to go to Red Robin before we took her to the airport. The server wasn't very friendly she slid our drinks across the table to us instead of setting them down in front of us. My husband ordered a burger with a specific cheese in it and did not get it. When he mentioned it to the server he asked about how long it would take to get a new burger, she replied "not sure, we are busy!" So my husband never got to eat. She was telling the manager to take it off our tab and he looked over at us and walked away. Never came to apologize. Pretty sure we will never return because this wasn't our first bad experience.although it is only 5 minutes from our house. Never again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Ok I have to say this is the worst Red Robin I have ever eaten at.   We were in the Neighborhood looking at Tile and Granite and were starving.  It is hard to tell if it is even open as it looks dark from the outside, sadly it was open, and we entered. We were sat, asked for the Gluten Free Menu and got it, perused our menu, asked for another minute or two, our Waitress who also seemed was the Bartender, finally came back and took our order. It took quite sometime to get our food and when mine arrived the fries were lukewarm, my Husband asked them to bring me fresh fries which they did, those were nice and hot.  The food was OK, the service was ehhhh, they seem to have a ton of staff, but I was not impressed with their service. This particular RR just had a weird vibe, ambiance and was not as good as the one I normally visit in Beaverton.  In the Beaverton RR they open the door for you on your way in and out, so such courtesy at this place.

Hey its Red Robin. I don't have high expectations and am not disappointed. I had the SW Chicken salad ( I know its a burger place)  and it was good. I like the grilled chicken and I was saving room for a great pizza tonight. This location is superior to the Vancouver Mall location reviewed a week ago. Better service and better salad.
Have been going to Red Robin since it opened.  Last night was horrible,  food cold, no silverware, you name it.  Too bad, they used to be good

Too many hostesses that were very busy interacting with one another.  They had an,upset customer, and instead of working to exceed his expectations, they laughed about the situation after the customer left

It's a chain. It serves burgers. It's conveniently located close to home. I can take my kids there and not feel like I'm annoying anyone if they happen to get a little loud. Those are the things I like about chain/family oriented places. Can I get a better burger somewhere else? Of course. However, RR's burgers are actually pretty good and there's something about their seasoning that I can't resist (I think there may be crack in it or something). You put that stuff on fries and you're in fried potato carb heaven!  When I go places like RR I'm not expecting some fine dining experience and when you're in suburbia where almost all of the employees are teenagers you grow to expect that most of them are more interested in what their fellow servers are doing then what customers are doing. This is a common theme in Sherwood as most of the restaurants are staffed by the hundreds of teenagers (what else is there to do out here anyway?). As long as they take my order and bring my food and I don't have to chase them down to eat I don't care.

My guilty pleasure on Friday nights.....nice juicy cheeseburger and steak fries, takeout and parked on the couch in front of a good movie, can't be beat! They always give me wayyyy too many fries, too many sauces, and this is a good thing! On the occasions we do go it, staff is always great and super attentive to us. Great place!
Bad food, but it is Red Robin, you get what you pay for - sort of. I recommend spending your money somewhere else.
They won't let you bring outside food in that's bs and the food have my brother diarrhea and me

I got to say red Robin has really stepped up their game. With bottomless fries yeah everybody does that but also vegetables or fruit or did I mention the sweet potato fries they are delicious with campfire sauce. Is just a chain and you do get chain service you know young kids and such but I do think that the one star reviews are little misguided. It's a burger joint with great burgers and decent service good place to stop.

We went back to the Sherwood Red Robin today (My wife announced she was STARVING). While our last visit was a bit disappointing, this time was very good. I ordered the special called the Colossus Burger which is beef, beef brisket, and grilled onions with BBQ and Campfire sauce. It was a good choice and arrived hot and in a very reasonable amount of time. My wife ordered the Teriyaki chicken sandwich, which she always loves.  We asked for french fries before the burgers arrived and our waitress brought them quickly with the sauces we requested. They were hot and fresh. The ones that arrived with the burgers were as well.  The colossus burger is something I liked seeing them add to the menu, even if only as a special. The brisket was smokey and flavorful. The onions were cooked until they were just transparent. The burger was very good and I would certainly order it again. Red Robin proves again that it is a solid choice as a family-friendly burger restaurant.

Our experience was ok.  Arrived at 4:45pm on a Friday and stood waiting for about 5 minutes to even be acknowledged.  I know that doesn't sound long but we were the only ones waiting and there were 2 employees just standing at the counter discussing something.  Our server was nice but the food took 20 minutes which I thought was odd because there were only about 10 people in the place with 3 cooks and about 8-10 servers.  My wings were luke warm but I ate them anyway because I didn't want to have to wait longer to eat.  I like Red Robin but I was disappointed this trip.

Good burgers nice environment (although they are redecorating so it's a tad bland today) we get the bar area, if you have kids expect a wait. A little bit formulaic but that's the way it works now. I love the banzai burger though my favorite.

This store just got all remodeled and it looked great! so the hostess seats us and along the window seal there is dirt and food ect, like old food and ketchup smeared all over. so gross! you would think being newly remodeled it would be clean...no just new stuff installed over the grime. we order and our food  it took forever to get to us. then one of our meals had no chicken on the wrap so the guy brings me a bowl of chicken..like for me to add to my wrap...i asked for it to be remade.(not make myself by adding the chicken he brought) so he did. the place is a joke...bad service, dirty, and we will not be going back. This stores cleanliness is aweful!

At chain restaurants like Red Robin, you should know what to expect, including consistent quality food, consistent quality service, and a friendly, clean atmosphere.  I have eaten at this Sherwood Red Robin twice in 3 weeks, both Sunday dinners on the way back from wine country, and had a consistently negative experience both times.  The food is like every other Red Robin - pretty good, nice to have GF and some healthier options.   The very poor service and unfriendly atmosphere is what stand out at the Sherwood RR.  Both Sunday nights we waited and waited to even get water after being seated.  Meanwhile tables being seated after ours got their service.  Servers appear to be randomly assigned to new tables, and are not assigned by section from what I can tell, so it appears to be just luck as to when you get served.  The first night we waited almost 20 minutes to have somebody take our order.  Tonight we waited over 7 minutes for water until I had to work hard to get the hostess and manager's attention.  Not fun when you have a hungry young child with you.  The hostess had a serious chip on her shoulder and was most unfriendly.  The servers both nights apologized and were very nice, but they seem saddled with poor management and a bad serving set-up.  The female manager the first night was pleasant, the male manager tonight did not seem interested in hearing a negative comment.  The bathrooms are subpar, with garbage cans overflowing and dirty toilets.   Not returning to the Sherwood RR.

We used to LOVE this red robin and come here every weekend. Recently they remodeled and looks like hired all new staff and the food and service was so disappointing! Paid extra for cold, stale garlic bread which used to be included in a meal. Got very few "bottomless" fries which were cold. Prices went up ($4.50 for a lemonade!?) and service went down. We won't be returning.
So loud. I have been here a couple time and the nice level is crazy, but the servers are nice and the food tastes that same as every other red robin. Great for kids
Newly remodeled and clean BUT......don't expect prompt customer service ;( be ready to wait a little bit. Food is always good and the server brewed fresh coffee for me ;)

The fact that I have kept coming here obviously makes me insane. The service is always bad. And I don't have high hopes in the first place. I have to interrupt the giggling teenage gab fest at the front door to get a menu and seated. You have to ask for more than one drink at a time because who knows when you will see the server again. And don't even think about ordering to go- you will be there for 45mins (after you called ahead 20mins) and the order is never correct. I am 26 and this place makes me feel 86 and I should be telling kids to get off my lawn.

Just like it the star rating says A-ok, not locally owned, not locally sourced, no amazing service, but if you need some A-ok service and  food that is pretty much the same in Oregon, Washington or anywhere else you might happen to than this is a sure bet. If your look for excitement and something different and unique.... keep looking.

Whisky river burger was as described.., would I order it again? Hmm, no. The bun was fresh, fresh.. and the fries, as always, great.., but an offered 16 oz Stella which is actually 11.5oz (330ml, says so right on the glass) at more than $6 is a rip! Most expensive beer in Oregon.., come on guys..!

Great kitchen staff, the food was outstanding compared to already consistently tasty RR fare. However, waitstaff suffers a bad combination of laziness / arguementative. Tried the old "there's no booths" stunt when there were plainly 3 in view, then got arguementative about whether the table we were seated at was wobbly. Also, not posting soft drink prices on the menu is downright obnoxious.

I asked for two things;  1) A Gluten Free Menu. I was told they do not have a printed version and it is only available on-line. Must assume everyone has a phone. 2) A Spanish Coffee. I was told that they do not make those anymore because they do not want  high alcohol as 151. I assume they do not trust their employees to make a Spanish Coffee without burning the place down. My phone was in the car charging. I could of used my husband's phone but why should I have to.  All I wanted to know is if they had other options then the regular menu.  At home I went on-line to look . It is interactive and sure would of been miserable to do this on a phone. All is the same as the restaurant menu and the only substitution they have is a gluten free bun. The server could of just offered this information but he  said to go on-line as he was walking away from our table to help another. So excuse me for taking up your time. We left.

Well, this location finally convinced us to retire as customers of Red Robin. While the food isn't bad, it's not worth waiting 40 minutes for when the place is only half full (and still super loud). The clincher was (as many others have mentioned) the snotty service - our server acted as though we were inconveniencing her at every step of our meal. Plenty of other - and better - restaurants out there.
My boyfriend and I ate here at the Sherwood red robins for our first time. Our waiter Sean was so prompt and attentive. Everything was delicious. Will be back soon!!!

I prefer this location to the wash squre one. This one is larger.  I have always had great service here.  The prices seem to go up with inflation, year after year.  Lol I remember when the clucks and fries were like $7.00.  They are always generous on their fries and dipping sauces.  Its nice that they have added a bunch more dippers to choose from too.

Our horrible experience cost our family of 5 $55.00. We received a $25 gift card from RR apologizing and asking us to try again so only 4 of us wearily went so that we didn't have to spend our money on another terrible experience. The server was awesome. Just wonderful. She got a great tip. 3 stars is the food rating. The kids Mac & cheese was perfect (premade and microwaved, can't really screw it up). I stayed clear of the BLTA but ordered a lettuce wrapped teriyaki chx burger. I'm pretty sure I only received 1/2 the chicken breast on the burger... oooooor they are trying to cut expenses. Our family loved RR. We ate there weekly and for all birthdays and most gatherings. The food quality  is not the same anymore. I very much appreciate the effort in sending us the gift card... but I think we are going to take a Red Robin break. Who knows. Maybe absence will make the stomach grow fonder ;0)

Awful Red Robin. I came here expecting the great food and service that Red Robin usually delivers but this place was horrid. The service was some of the worst I've ever had, anywhere. The drinks were terrible. I would not recommend this place at all. Red Robin needs to evaluate this place and make some major changes. This place sucked. I'm very disappointed. Do NOT go here.
Great service & really good food! You really do get what you pay for at Red Robin. There sandwiches are very good and there bottomless fries are so addicting!

Sensory overload. Very loud, very busy, too many TVs. Hamburgers are good but the rest is just too much. I don't like to yell to carry on a conversation. The 2 stars isn't just for this location -- all Red Robins are like this. Not my cup of tea.

ALWAYS there's something not quite right: Tonights surprise; The Red Robin law: NO corn dogs for adults. Period. We wanted just one as our appetizer... we got the text book "just for kids", and then like this was a test, he waited with a blank stare for a better answer. Ok, then no appetizer required. Let's see; what is the final score? No extra cash (or tip) for RR, and NO repeat business from us. Wow, that was a win win.
The food is usually pretty good but ever since their remodel the service hasn't been the best.

I have always liked RR, it's  my adult son's favorite place.  We've been to this location many times and always had good food and service.  This trip the food was good, service was o.k., drink wasn't refilled as many have stated.  What I'm nock in them down for is the disregard for the customer.  It was later in the evening and business was slowing down when I heard this slamming noise, like slapping two pieces of wood together REALLY loud, making me jump.  It happened a couple more times.  I looked at another member of our party who said it was annoying.  It was the staff slamming the hinged leaves of the table back under the table, as loud as they possibly could, without regard for customers.  It was loud enough that I wouldn't want to come back.  As we were leaving I had a staff member cut right in front of me as if I didn't exist, and he was much more important than me.  What happened to the customer coming first?

They sat us at the bar.  Our waitress was nice but spilt our my drink all over my phone and keys.  Okay accidents happened I said.  Our table next to us gave us napkins faster than our waitress.  she said that some guy was going to finish taking care of our order. Again no problem.  He brought out our order.  That's were things went down hill after that.  We had to get up and get our own refill drinks,  we asked for some honey mustard  several times because he kept forgetting.   We asked for refils on our fries more than once and only got one refill.  He spilt beer on another table behind us. This is my third time in there.  Every time I have been there there, there has been an issue.  The decore bottles in the bar looks like it had the same amount of dust if not more near the vents .  Which was blowing dust on us and the food.  Obviously the management tells me he doesn't really care to take care of the restaurant nor the facility it self.   Shear laziness!!!  I use to be a restaurant manager so I know all about it.   The food was very dry with no flavor.  Teriyaki buger didn't taste any teriyaki at all. Tastedclike a regular burger with pineapple and cheese. Needless to say we will Not be giving this restaurant another try!!!

Better today than the last couple of times.   My oldest son wanted to here so we did.  Our sever was quick and efficient, she needs to smile, looks like she was having a basic day.  Had a new tavern burger was very good.  It had a couple different kinds of cheese and and chips on it.  I wasn't sure about the chips but they were good.  They added a light crunch without being overwhelming.

I'm a fan of Red Robin. Bottom line: they make a solid burger. Quite a few beers on tap and they have great sweet potato fries. It's a great place to come with my infant daughter because it's family friendly and packed with kids, no one cares if she chirps a bit during our meal. The location has plenty of parking and I've only had to wait during prime dinner hours. I've only encountered friendly, capable staff.

Service was slow. No drink refills. They remodeled and in an effort to look more trendy or something they changed their plates. They also changed ow they make things. I got a cob salad that I used to really enjoy but now it's maybe one slice of avocado chopped up pea sized a slice of tomatoe pea size. No olives. Cumcumer with skins on so it was the waxy thick skin (not English) no focaccia bread. No egg.  Basically I paid over 10 dollars for overlooked chicken and lettuce I won't go back. There are too many better places to go. My kids wanted to go there. I won't make the mistake again. Yuck

Staff was friendly and welcoming from the initial greeting all the way throughout the meal and leaving. We were seated and served quickly. It took us about as long to order as it did to get the food so hard to complain about that. Pete was our waiter and he did a great job. Friendly and quick witted. That came in handy because I tend to have a hard time deciding what I want or having a clue as to what different food options mean. He was also attentive to our table needs. Overall the customer service was enjoyable. My food was also excellent, I had the burger with the fried egg and bacon on it. That was darn tasty! There were four of us and three were happy with the quality of the food. One of us ordered the fish basket and he said that was a bad choice. So my advice would be to stick with burgers or salads, and also upgrade to the garlic herb fries they were delicious. The value we got from the quality of the food to the quality of the service was really hard to beat. We had a negative experience elsewhere at a different eating establishment the next day so the difference in the two was very telling. If you want good food in a place with good service stop in here and ask for Pete.

Living in Sherwood there have only been a select few restaurants to eat at. When you want a burger, Red Robin is one of the few places to go. Unfortunately the service is unpredictable, wait is terrible and food frequently comes out wrong. Don't even think about going here on a Saturday evening because the wait exceeds an hour. The only good thing is when it's busy, the service seems to be better. I've been twice in the last month during the day or a weeknight when it wasn't busy and still had to wait. Not sure why. The service at these times is beyond bad with the server not bringing drinks, putting in the orders wrong and not checking in. It's amazing to me how it can be wonderful one time and horrid the next. Unfortunately for Red Robin this location isn't the only one I've seen decline in their service and have wrong orders coming out recently.

No stars!!! Called 3 times and took forever to answer and put on hold! Took almost an hour to get my grilled cheese for my daughter!!! Bug crawling on bar counter while waiting. This Red Robin has gone down hill!!!

Just left. Poor service. Entry crowded and water spilled all over the floor with nothing being done. Sat in bar area and just briefly acknowledge us and "be right with you". 15 min later she refilled and brought drinks to all the tables around us and next to us be still no menu or drink order taken. Got up to leave and then told sorry for not serving us yet. She asked if we wanted to speak to the manager as if that would have helped. Said no and went to another establishment in Sherwood. Plenty that want the business. We were served fast at the other restaurant. Won't be coming back for some time if ever as continually poor service. Live in area and have a lot to chose from.

I will never go there again.  Slow service, cold food, undercooked.  Wait staff is vacant.  Dinner delivered by unknown person, no followup.   I have tried to give them a second and third chance, but there is nothing but inferior food with bad service.

Geeeez this place was crazy crowded on a Wednesday night. Good for them. Lots of large groups and lots of families coming in for dinner after sports practice. The wait for our party of 4 was about 30mins. At least it was exactly as long as they said.  This was a pretty new location. This whole area is still kinda uncharted land for the modern strip mall look so this whole mall was an upgrade to the general area.  The restaurant was super clean. Lots of big screens playing sports and a bunch of cool posters and memorabilia that Red Robin is famous for having. Restrooms were clean too.  Service was great. Prompt and friendly. Checked up on us often and food came out quick.   Food was standard Red Robin flair. Decent but run of the mill for me. Im not knocking Red Robin, but its the ol regular quality meats with lots of different toppings to choose from. I got the american chicken sandwich, wife got the whiskey river bbq chicken sandwich and my niece got the burger wrapped in lettuce. We got the onion ring stack too. Kinda greasy but whatever.  Overall I would have given the place a 4 since it was super clean and had great service but the food takes it down a notch to 3. Still a fun place to take the family or your group for a lot of laughs in a fun environment.

We are RR fans. It's our place when we want gluten free options everyone can enjoy. I will be leaving a one star review for one reason: the surprise iPads at the tables that charged money with zero opt-in consent that we were being charged for a game my kids played. We thought it was free. We don't want them at our table luring our kids and we don't like the distraction. Please RR see this and take them away now. We told them we don't want it and he left it there because I think it is now policy that it has to be there. We will move them every time we visit until they are revoked. Update: no drink refilled, no bottomless fries served. Plate taken when I wasn't looking.

Long time RR fan,  one of my families favorite places to eat,  but for the past year this sherwood RR has gone down hill. The food is still good but the service is horrible from the hostess to the servers.  Always come back hoping it will get better,  with the change of mangers three times you think someone could get this place better service. Plus they stopped giving fries before your meal.
Always great food here for the family. Service can be hit or miss. The kids love the variety of choices. The DGB is a new favorite.
Love this RR location. They are usually pretty busy, but I have always had good service, burgers, and beer.

Here on oct 10,in the evening. Hostesses seemed lazy tellng people wait times that were well over wait ( even though there were empty tables, They shorted us a menu, and didn't give us coloring page until we asked for our kid because they had to cut open a new box. Our Server was great, which is why they get 2 stars.  The mens and women's restrooms were filthy! I don't think it had been cleaned all day because there was trash overflowing paper towel rolls just thrown onto the counters instead of in the empty dispensers. Needs better management. They used to have the manager walk around and talk to customers, we never saw them.

Wow!  RR should be ashamed of this location. I have never seen such filthy, disgusting bathrooms as here. To make things worse the hostess was unfriendly and had no clue how to greet guests. That's my last visit to RR ever.

I hate the new format.  I never minded paying almost $10 for a burger that comes in a basket, but the new plates they serve them on look like someone used them for bobsledding. I don't like that the fries come in a silver cup, designed to only fit so many fries. Also, The computer they put on the table takes up a lot of space, and is designed so that the server never has to come back to your table. They should go back to the plastic baskets.  Everything about the place now screams "cost control".  I can't wait for the spaghetti factory to open next to them.

Red Robin used to be my favorite restaurant. The past five times I've gone here, however, changed my mind. You'd think I would learn sooner lol. The chili cheese fries tasted stale and cold and the chili on top was dry and looked like it had been sitting for a few hours. The burger was a joke and had waaaaaay too much mayonnaise. My sister ordered a veggie burger and the patty came out slimy. Don't get me started on how there's now a tablet on every table, taking up about half the space on the teeny tables and covered in grubby fingerprints. Seriously no one needs more games and distractions when it's hard enough eating out with family and friends as it is with smart phones.  Eat here at your own risk.
Typical fare.  Good service.  Slow, slow kitchen for a Friday night. 45 minutes to get our food in a 65% filled restaurant. Once every 7.1 weeks is too often.

Won't be back to this location... After placing an order over the phone with a guy who seemed too distracted to be answering calls I arrive and they've completely messed up the order. I repeated the order THREE times. Three. They still messed it up and on top of that completely forgot to include an extra order of fries yet charged for it. They offer to remake the burger they messed up and I think okay it'll be quick... Nope. 25 minutes. That's on top of the 30 minutes I had already waited to get the other food (which is cold at this point). Pushing an hour and NO ONE offers to comp the meal they screwed up.  I'll go to another location next time.
Poor service. Received girlfriends entree 20 mins before appetizer and burger. The red robin is running around with its head cut off like the staff. Hope they get it together

Don't bother . we waited with three other groups at the door despite the place being slow. the servers were nice but everything was slow. Food just average.  Bathrooms out of toilet paper. Towel machine not working. Very disappointing.

Eat here with family about once a month.  Would eat here more often but overall the experience is less than satisfactory. Food is usually good, service is usually poor.   The other night my wife ordered a avacado salad.  It had almost no avacado!!!  I was filling out the electronic survey when the waitress asked if there had been a problem.  She said she has had this comment before and we should have asked for more avacado.  In this restaurant servers are usually scarce when you want one.  This seems to be their mantra.  Rather than do things right from the start,  wait for the customer to complain and then apologize.

Since the remodel and "name change" to Red Robin Burgers and Brews the service and food have declined. Service is not nearly as upbeat or friendly and definitely not as fast. The fact you can't get fries before your food unless you pay $2, the games on the iPad that take away from a conversational table and overall the portion size and quality has gone down. Been going to Red Robin forever but not a fan of the new changes and darker not as family friendly environment.

Great times with people I dont really care for. Red Robin made it happen despite the feeling of an akward encounter with my ex-girlfriend with her new fiance. That was quiclly erased with tbe savory taste of A-1 peppercorn burger.  Thank you RR

-Almost like a drive-thru without a car.  -Host slam you into a tiny booth, while thirty of the wait staff walk by at a hundred miles an hour. Nobody will give you a chance to ask a question.  -The food is good, but the quality and size portions have shrunk, while the prices stayed the same.  -Get rid of all the decor, and contraband. Bring back the quality and customer service.

Sat at a table in carpeted section. Floor was filthy! Ever hear of a cordless vacuum after a table clears? Also had a great view of kitchen area entrance littered with debris. There an hour and the numerous servers standing there or walking by failed to clean it even though a broom and dust pan sat among the debris. Bathrooms were trashed as well. Greasy film on tables especially sides of tables that don't look like they're ever wiped. Food was standard fare but I'm not going back unless the management figures out how to clean up the place. Unbelievable!

You want bottom of the shoe food....go to Red Robin in Sherwood. How do I know? I was there when an employee in the kitchen asked another employee: What are you doing? The response: It was only on the ground for a minute....the fryer will burn it off.  Are you kidding me. The 5 second rule is just a joke....right?  Not here....just drop my food on the floor...then "cook" the bacteria off. Goodbye Red Robin....hello Spaghetti Factory

I've never had a problem at this Red Robin, or any, for that matter, until today. We stood at the hostess station for 10 minutes before we were even acknowledged. It's a Thursday at 3, I understand it's not the busiest time, but at least make an effort to see if you have customers waiting every couple minutes. After being seated a waiter takes our drink and appetizer order. A few minutes later our actual server comes by to take our entree order. I told him I wanted my egg over easy for my burger (this is my go to order, and I'm always asked by my other waiters so I just wanted to make sure it was done the way I wanted), to which he responded "Well, if you read your menu it comes that way," in a very condescending tone. Not the biggest deal, but still. Our food comes out about 30 minutes later, and we still haven't received our appetizer (which were just fries that had cheese, bacon, and jalapenos and shouldn't take 40 minutes to come out). In fact, they could've used my fries from my entree for my appetizer. The only person who was apologetic about it was the guy who wasn't even our server. After take a bite of my food I wanted to wipe my hands off, but of course there are no napkins and after waiting for 5 minutes my boyfriend has to flag down another waiter to get them. Now that our entrees were almost gone and we were just now getting our appetizer, our drinks were empty and our waiter never came to refill them. I wanted a refill of my fries, and I had to flag the waiter down for that, without the chance to ask for a drink refill. After waiting another 15 minutes, I had to wave the server over to ask for a to go box for my fries and our check (we forgot that the tablets now replace the server). Our meal was $30 or so, so we paid $40 in cash, and when the waiter came back he asked, "Do you need change?" If he was expecting a $10 (about 35%) tip for doing nothing, while almost every other waiter in the restaurant did his job for him, the joke is on him.

No tomato, no tomato, no tomato, no pink, no pink. Just to make sure. Oh would you look at that! Tomatoes! And oh, the patty is very pink inside! Im pretty sure i made clear what i wanted on my order. Im not gonna re order it because it has taken for ever to get our food anyway. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant. Sorry
Service excellent , Food on time and perfectly cocked, clean inside, Dominique we will be back

Or last visit was less than good, but with the changes they have made were will be returning soon!  Our waitress was kind she got us all we asked for seemed approchable without hovering and advised us well. The burger my husband had was the ghost tavern burger and it was the first time he got one where he felt the heat yea! The healthy choices like lettuce wrapping burgers let me have a treat of deep fried pickles OMG they were so good I ate them all. Our friend had fish and chips and the onion rings she was thrilled. The manager even stopped but to see if all was well.  Very impressed all around and recommend you try it out.

We enjoy Red Robins food. But today we placed a take out order and got our meals and were shocked and the serving size. We paid 9 dollars for the mozzarella sticks and pickles. They charged us 5 dollars for the pickles and let me tell you, there was about half a pickle in there. 5 dollars for 10 pickle chips?!?! What a RIP off... Next time I'll make sure to check the boxes before I leave... I uploaded the picture of the child size appetizer.

Terrible service, same old "cookie cutter burgers" and whats with the metal cup of fries? Since the metal cup insertion, fries are cold to lukewarm...yuk! Past three visits with same results....terrible service and lukewarm food. Seems most locations have same problems, not just here. Maybe they've grown too big to properly Manage anymore. Its a shame..use to be pretty good. Btw.....woulda given one star, but added a second because they bring hot fries if you can get their attention.

We have stopped to and from our drives to PDX. The service has been good, but we always sit in the bar, rather than in the restaurant area. We like the burgers and now know to order the extra fries with dinner rather than later. Beer is over priced as are the burgers with the deluxe meat, seeing how they taste just like the regular ones. For a quick beer and burger on the fly, it's decent but better in the bar.

Went for dinner and drinks the other day and we sat on the patio. The menu is huge, first off. I ordered the Spanish style salad and it was absolutely excellent. I also tried the half margarita half pina colada drink (blended) and it has become my new favorite! I've been disappointed the last few times I went to a different red robin so I'm happy to see that the Sherwood one is so excellent! They forgot to put bacon on my friends wrap so they brought out a side of bacon and they also came out and offered to only charge her half for the wrap. Our waitress, a lady whose name I have forgotten, was also very friendly and attentive. I will definitely be back!!

Hate the (new) bar.  Way too crowded.  Even the wait staff complains about the tight quarters.  And, being height challenged, the tall bar seating is terrible--especially when you have to be assisted with whoever accompanies you.

Stopped in here for dinner, and had the good and the bad. Honestly I've never been a huge Red Robin fan, overpriced fast food burgers, etc. I had the new Tavern Mac and Cheese, and was pleasantly surprised.... Surprised that it was pretty good, and surprised because the serving size looked like it was for my daughter (which for $7 it should have been bigger). Anyways, it was really tasty, and not their usual non-dazzling menu item. The Freckled Limeade hit the spot since it was so friggin hot outside, so that was a nice bonus. The service was fair, and the waitresses were friendly. An above par visit this time around...

We headed in around 1, and I was really hungry because it was past my usual lunch time. The waitress was friendly took our order then we waited...and waited and waited.  People who were seated after us were served before us. I asked what the problem was and didn't really understand the responses he gave me? I don't mean to be negative and I normally don't leave reviews but the wait was ridiculous.  We were about ready to walk out when our food turned the corner...I will not be back anytime soon.

Food poisoning. 'Nuff said. Well, pal enjoyed her garden/veggie burger with no ill effects; I had a cheeseburger and was not happy later on that evening and night. Took a while to get the food Sunday afternoon even though place wasn't that busy. Perhaps that should have been my cue. :(

Normally have good experience at Red Robbin. I took my 2 kids to the sherwood location yesterday. Our waitress seemed disinterested in being at work.  We ordered 3 drinks and we're never asked if we wanted refills, water, fries, napkins, etc.  Basically, our food got dropped off and then we didn't see her again. Food was fine, just not the warmest experience with thand we left parched!

So we had a bad experience with the one in willsonville, but the Sherwood location brought Red Robyn to a whole new low. Two missed orders for my wife ( waiter brings out the burger and it's not the right one, they go back to cook another and cook the wrong item again). Not a peep from the management. When leaving I see the manager and tell her what happened, she asked if we paid as we were exiting the restaurant. I said yes (of course). She looks at me and says "that's too bad", turns and goes about her business. So two items to note. One, the management is so oppressive, the employees are scared to come clean on mis-orders. Two, I can see why they would be scared if the management is this out of touch with their customers. After review with my wife we will never go back to a Red Robin again, the corporation has lost our business en-whole.

Food was good, it was a busy night and they took over 50 min to get the food out, and the kids and wives were given the wrong food.   The manager came and offered to pay half the check.  It was good to be regarded when the kitchen runs behind.  The waiter was new and he felt bad, but I told him it wasn't his fault.  What was worse is it was my friend's bday.  If not for the waiter and management, this could've easily gone bad.

Went there tonight, there were at least 6 open booths, and the host said it would be at least 20 minutes or more wait time, that's insane since everyone that was waiting was a big party waiting for a big table..I doubt I'll go to the Sherwood Red Robin again, I'll drive past them just to get better service elsewhere.

This used to be a favorite location of mine! :(  My past two times have been quite bad. Servers and bartenders can't handle their sections... we at the bar right at the front and no one came to speak to use until 15+ minutes. In that time multiple people around us got menus, and water... weird?! As it's a chain, the food was what you expect. Totally fine. Cooked as requested. Thumbs up.  Service was lacking.  After getting halfway through our meal we told the bartender we wanted to order 1 item to go so we could take it when we were done.  We ordered an item to go and didn't get it for a while... finished our meal. Waited more.  Then walked up to the host stand to ask the ETA on the food to go. It was sitting getting cold for 10 minutes... :(  I think the servers and bartenders need a few more people on the floor or a manager to help out. This would also turn tables quicker, and they'd make more money.

Had lunch at this location Dec 24th. The waitress was great, but the food not so much. I ordered a royal red robin burger and a side a pub style Mac and cheese. The burgers are supposed to be gourmet, but I don't believe I have ever had Kraft singles on a gourmet burger before. Also, the pub Mac and cheese was too watery and also included Kraft cheese along wtith parmesan. I really was disappointed. I guess I'll just stick to my local red robin.

No comcast sports network.  Don't come here to watch a Trailblazer game.  We asked hostess before getting seated if they carried the game.  She told us yes.  We sat down and ordered.  After we repeatedly requested game to be turned on we were finally informed that they don't carry the channel.  Have to support the local team.  Come on man!

I feel that this red robin is getting it's act together. It doesn't seem to be as dysfunctional as it used to be. Since Colleen and I have been on the whole30, we have really limited our going out to eat. We have made it here a couple of times and it has been decent. There aren't a ton of options for the whole30 but we do the grilled chicken burger minus the sauces, cheese and bacon. It isn't bad. But this isn't a plug for the whole30.  The staff seems to be more attentive and overall not a bad experience.

We came here because the kids like it. When we were seated at the table there was most of someone's lunch left under the table. This is one is the dirtiest restaurants I've ever been to. We will not be coming back.

I really wish I could give half star on this one. My office and myself have tried doing pick-up orders through this location multiple times. Not one time have they gotten our orders correct. The food is always below par and Their customer service is terrible. We called to let them know, they had my co worker go back to pick up the correct order. This was the most disappointing part. The food she picked up after all of this was wilted brown and soggy. When she said she didn't even want it anymore, they did not offer a refund or any compensation, they giggled and said "well, sorry!" So here I am. Well, sorry Red Robin. I think our company is going elsewhere.

Let me start by saying don't give customers a device to ping a waiter if you don't pay attention to it.  Sunday afternoon my husband and our 2 children were running errands and needed some lunch.  We really wanted a good cheeseburger. We arrived at 11:30am (30 min after opening.) they weren't that busy maybe 7 tables. We were sat by a the hostess who said our waiter would be with us shortly for drinks.  During that time we saw the new "tablets" on the table.  We figured out what we wanted to eat and drink and pressed call the server. No one came (not even to give us water). The red light turned off and we pinged the waiter again.  After pinging the second time a couple was seated one table away.  The waiter went to them promptly and got them water.  He then proceeded to go back to take the couples order.  It was now 12pm and we had not even been acknowledged. At this point our children were antsy and my husband and I quite angry.  We got up and left.  We went to schmizza public house.  If you want great food and amazing staff go to Schmizza instead. Never going back to Red Robin again! Unacceptable.

Why is it always freezing in this restaurant???  I have a sweater and wool socks and I'm COLD!!!  Even the men are wearing jackets or down vests inside.  Bartender said it's controlled by corporate...really?  What state are they in...Florida?  In Oregon one must have heat on even in May...53 degrees and raining requires the thermostat to be set above 63.

Seriously the worst Red Robin.  Not consistent at all.  Kitchen can be slow as molasses and orders mixed up.  Poorly managed.  I like love other Red Robin's like the one in Albany always provides top notch food AND service.

Red robin is the new standard for burger joints.  Above average food, service, and atmosphere blowing away dennys, sharis, applebees, and most other mom and pop shops with better quality and consistency.  Burgers are well seasoned and cooked medium.  Lots of options including veggie burgers, bunless, and chicken burger swaps.   Entrees are various and many are weight watchers friendly.  They are very happy to customize meals and substitute.  Sides are many and bottomless.  Want zero point sides?  Salads and steam broccoli are bottomless.   Service is always ok to great.  They definitely get bogged down from 5 to 7 so plan accordingly.

Ordered the chips/guac/salsa appetizer for our family through an online order. Paid for extra chips, extra guac, and extra salsa. Almost $10 total. Received the tiniest scoop of salsa and guac at the bottom of a large bowl. It was comical. I called immediately and spoke to the manager. After reviewing my receipt while I waited on the phone to make sure I actually paid for all the "extras", she apologized. That was it. I asked her if she could do anything for me? She said if I wanted to drive back over they could "always give me more...." with a tone that clearly implied what I received was adequate, but they would deem to give me more. Told her we'd make a different choice for dinner next time. Sorry Red Robin. Your customer service is the worst at the Sherwood location. Thumbs down!!

Always great food. I had the Burger with an egg, bacon and no bun!! No need for seconds on fries perfect amount of food today.  I was so appreciative of the waitress to be at work so I didn't have to cook on this, The 4th of July. Why not a 5 stars. There were four dirty tables when we arrived and the same four tables were dirty on our departure.

My son and I sat at the bar and had the coldest beers. He ordered the burger with the egg and a side of Mac n cheese. We shared the pick two appetizer with mushrooms and cheese sticks. The mushrooms were big crispy and delicious. We also loved playing the bar top games. The bar seats are nice and comfy - not hard wood. Bonus for me. Service was great.  I thought the food was above average in a very comfy atmosphere.

First, they don't publish accurate beer prices on the menu (one of my pet peeves), so buyer beware. The menu said "select domestic 22 ounce drafts - $3.50", so I figured a simple domestic IPA would either be $3.50 or a buck or two more (max) ... WRONG ... when the check arrived I was shocked to see that i had to pay $7.79 for a domestic draft beer. This is exactly why I hate restaurants that do not publish prices (drinks or otherwise) on their menu. Never again! Then, they burned my wife's Four Cheese Melt ($7.99). Gordon Ramsey would have had a shit fit, but he was not there unfortunately. By the time we got our server's attention, it was late (after 9pm) and we had no choice other than to have the kitchen prepare an unburnt one. Where the hell is their quality control? We think the server may have attempted to offer an ice cream sundae for our trouble, but it was not obviously clear, stating: "can I bring you a sundae", instead of "we'd like to offer you an ice cream sundae on the house for your trouble". In the end, there was a $1 "Manager's Discount" on our check, bringing the price of my overpriced beer down to $6.79, still way too much. From their special Red Tavern ($6.99) menu I ordered the Pig Out Tavern Double with smoked bacon, bacon-crumble aioli and American cheese, upgrading it to a "gourmet" (larger) beef patty for a $4 up-charge apparently ($10.99 total on check). I have had MANY burgers in the $5.99 to $8.99 range at other locals that were far superior to this. It came with a small portion of "ENDLESS" fries, which are only endless if your server happens to stop by from time to time which ours did not. Nuff said. A real bummer, we will not be going back any time soon. Overpriced, small, and mediocre in flavor, if not burnt, I was completely unimpressed. CombatCritic Gives This Red Robin 3 Out Of 10 Bombs ... More Bombs Are Better! Three Bombs Equates To: SNAFU Translation for Civilians: SNAFU = You'll have to visit my blog to find out

This was possibly the worst meal that I have ever had from a Red Robin. We ordered our food over the phone which took like 10 minutes. I am pretty sure I was talking to an automated machine who wasn't even at that location. I wanted to do a petite salad which I never had an issue ordering but I was put on hold for a few minutes and was told I could be transferred to the store if I needed special assistance. We got to Red Robin around the same time as the lady on the phone said our order would be ready. We waited in the bar for over ten minutes waiting to be helped by someone to grab our food. Our food was ice cold and my sweet potato fries were not fully cooked. The new plastic containers don't help either. All the steam from the hot food stays in the contains and makes the fries and food soggy. You guys are trying to rely too much on technology. Where is the real customer service these days? I will never order food over the phone or online again. Next time I will be sure to go in to place my order so the food is fresh and I can talk to an actual human. Very disappointed in Red Robin.
Love this place. Wide range of burgers to choice from. Love the camp fire sauce for the bottomless fries.

Terrible disgusting experience. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger to-go with no mayo. Extra cheese. Gave me some kind of burger with mayo and chicken. Went back and the manager said she fixed the problem. Got home again and what do u know. Its got mayo and pickles. I didnt even ask for pickles and didnt inform me that it came with pickles. So instead of going back because i know red robin is a joke and wont fix the issue. I somehow ate this nasty fuckin burger. Red robin, you own me 14 fuckin dollars Oh also there was a hair in my first burger.

This review unfortunately is based upon a meal experience that did not end up happening because of a silly corporate policy many chain restaurants carry. That policy is not taking reservations. We had a group of almost 20 parents and high soccer players coming after a nearby game. We called Red Robin 2-days before and asked for a reservation and they said just show up. That seemed like a big risk of not being able to get a group our size in if the restaurant was busy, especially on a weeknight. The hostess who received the call did say she would "keep an eye out for us the night we were coming in to accommodate us as best they could". Awhile we appreciated the comment it was still concerning on our part if we could get in.  As a backup we did get a reservation at a nearby Sherwood establishment. But we wanted Red Robin first for all the years of enjoying ourselves there.  So the night came and we brought our group down there to enjoy post game dinner and spirits. What occurred next is what we feared would happen absent of a reservation....70+ minute wait! Ugh! Red Robin "keeping an eye out for us" didn't exactly workout. So we took our patronage to nearby Schmizza Public House where they easily took us in on our backup reservation.  Again, this is an unfortunate policy where almost 20 patrons from the surrounding community took away a black mark on RR and took their business elsewhere.

Strolled in for lunch one day - loved the endless options for sports on the many tv's, also loved the unique options of burgers! My only complaint was that it was cold in the building and the bar stools are just not comfortable at all. As for the food - fries were hot and fresh, burgers were tasty but my honeys just completely fell apart and was beyond messy. But is that what makes a good burger??

When we first arrived we were told there was a 10 minute wait. When they called our names and took us to the table, we noticed there were several empty tables. We sat there for 20 minutes waiting for somebody to even acknowledge that we were there. We watched several tables get helped that arrived after us. Very frustrating experience.
